g.text: Add Readme to tell other peop
Start writing in TypeScript to catch many err
Use Prettier for code formatting. To save time and energy and to have a consist
Keep the dependencies updated to eliminate security concerns and compatibility issues. Try to u
Continuous Integration (CI) is a practice of daily integrating code changes. Use CI to
reduce the integration risk, improve code quality and more.
Add Readme to tell other people why your project is useful, what they can do with your project,
and how they can use it.
Use a tests to point out the defects and errors that were made during the develop
ment phases. Jest and Mocha are the most widely used testing frameworks in the JavaScript community.
Add License to let others know what they can and can not do with your code.
Use a linter to catch dangerous code constructs. ESLint is the most widely used linter in the JavaScrip
ript code, making it easier to read and debug.
Add .editorconfig to define and maintain consistent coding styles between different editors
Use docker to create, deploy, and run applications easier by using containers.
Use a logger to help cut down on errors and even cyber attacks. Winston is the most widely used logg
ing library in the JavaScript community.
Start writing in TypeScript to catch many errors at compile-time. TypeScript simplifies JavaSc
Use Prettier for code formatting. To save time and energy and to have a consistent code style with Ja
We can help you with both. :-)
